pets.source:
Quest: Remembrance of Auberdine

Zone: Darkshore

pets.name: Calico Cat
pets.description: Many have mocked this cat before battle. Their last words are usually, 'Here, kitty, kitty.'
pets.source:
Vendor: Breanni

Zone: Crystalsong Forest

Cost: 50TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Curious Oracle Hatchling
pets.description: The bouncy gurloc is a distant cousin of the murloc.

pets.name: Curious Wolvar Pup
pets.description: Despite their smaller stature, the wolvar are some of the most aggressive creatures in Northrend. This often makes their curious nature intimidating.

pets.name: Warbot
pets.description: A fighting robot fueled by delicious red or blue electrolytes.

pets.name: Grunty
pets.description: Only the rarest of murlocs is able to successfully cross dimensional barriers. Fewer still return with the kind of advanced armor and weaponry possessed by Grunty.

pets.name: Shimmering Wyrmling
pets.description: This extremely rare species of mana wyrm is prized for its unique coloration and even temperament.
pets.source:
Vendor: Hiren Loresong

Zone: Icecrown

Faction: The Silver Covenant - Exalted

Cost: 40

pets.name: Jade Tiger
pets.description: Considered to be lucky, tigers carved of jade are prized, but taming a jade tiger itself is an even greater prize.

pets.name: Darting Hatchling
pets.description: Rarely leaves nest until maturity. Enjoys conducting pranks on the nearby Razormaw nest.
pets.source:
Drop: Dart's Nest

Zone: Dustwallow Marsh

pets.name: Deviate Hatchling
pets.description: The demand for this purple-skinned breed has drastically reduced the raptor population near the Wailing Caverns.
pets.source:
Drop: Deviate Guardian, Deviate Ravager

Zone: Wailing Caverns

pets.name: Gundrak Hatchling
pets.description: This crafty raptor was born in the icy wastes of Northrend. Its harsh upbringing gives it strength when many others would perish.

pets.name: Leaping Hatchling
pets.description: This offspring of Takk the Leaper is incredibly agile and can maneuver through difficult environments with ease.
pets.source:
Drop: Takk's Nest

Zone: The Barrens

pets.name: Obsidian Hatchling
pets.description: This hatchling is coveted for its unique coloration. Despite Breanni's loving care, the raptor's feral nature cannot be restrained.
pets.source:
Vendor: Breanni

Zone: Crystalsong Forest

Cost: 50TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Ravasaur Hatchling
pets.description: Larger than other raptor infants, these hatchlings grow into towering reptilian beasts capable of massive devastation.
pets.source:
Drop: Ravasaur Matriarch's Nest

Zone: Un'goro Crater

pets.name: Razormaw Hatchling
pets.description: Razormaw eggs are protected fiercely by their mothers. Their cuteness belies their inherited ferocity.
pets.source:
Drop: Razormaw Matriarch's Nest

Zone: Wetlands

pets.name: Razzashi Hatchling
pets.description: Razzashi raptors are among the cleverest predators in the jungle, making them favored by the Gurubashi trolls.
pets.source:
Drop: World Drop

Zone: Northern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

pets.name: Onyx Panther
pets.description: The onyx panther is invisible at night, like a stalking shadow, and disappears with the dawn.

pets.name: Tuskarr Kite
pets.description: Seeing these kites soaring above Northrend's shores is a clear sign that tuskarr are nearby.

pets.name: Spectral Tiger Cub
pets.description: Affectionate and curious, these kittens seem to find the most peculiar hiding places.

pets.name: Onyxian Whelpling
pets.description: Spawn of Onyxia, this young dragon has decided that it doesn't want to follow in its grandfathers' cataclysmic footsteps.
pets.source:
Achievement: WoW's 5th Anniversary

Category: Feats of Strength

pets.name: Core Hound Pup
pets.description: Found in the Firelands and the Molten Core, core hounds can trace their lineage back to the alpha male, Magmadar.

pets.name: Gryphon Hatchling
pets.description: A gift from the Wildhammer dwarves to the heroes of the Alliance, these hatchlings are descendants of the same gryphons ridden by Falstad and his entourage into Grim Batol.

pets.name: Wind Rider Cub
pets.description: Thorg No-Legs never paid heed to the old orc saying, 'Don't pull a wyvern's tail.'

pets.name: Zipao Tiger
pets.description: A rarely seen family of tigers, many believe (perhaps incorrectly) that some residual magic or other event is responsible for the unique color.

pets.name: Pandaren Monk
pets.description: The pandaren monk is a fearless traveling companion, constantly training in his art... unless you offer him a drink. He considers it rude to refuse.

pets.name: Lil' K.T.
pets.description: In life, Kel'Thuzad betrayed the Kirin Tor and created the Cult of the Damned. In death, he serves the Scourge as the Archlich Lord of Naxxramas.

pets.name: Perky Pug
pets.description: Although small, pugs are very dangerous when provoked.
pets.source:
Achievement: Looking For Multitudes

Category: Dungeons & Raids

pets.name: Toxic Wasteling
pets.description: This, um, 'adorable' little guy likes to play with critters. Just don't let them get too close.
pets.source: World Event: Love is in the Air

pets.name: Frigid Frostling
pets.description: While not nearly as destructive as its original master, the Ice Lord Ahune, the frostling has been known to lob chilly snowballs at unsuspecting adventurers.

pets.name: Blue Clockwork Rocket Bot
pets.description: Jepetto's top-selling toy this season, the bot's new blue chassis has children across Azeroth scrambling for this feisty battle bot.

pets.name: Celestial Dragon
pets.description: Breanni in Dalaran, one of the world's foremost collectors of exotic pets, will only award the mystical Celestial Dragon to fellow collectors whose obsession rivals her own.
pets.source:
Achievement: Littlest Pet Shop

Category: Pet Battles

pets.name: Lil' XT
pets.description: Modeled after the huge titan prototype in Ulduar, this volatile little construct plays hard with its toys.

pets.name: Murkimus the Gladiator
pets.description: Murkimus is the most fearsome of all murloc arena warriors. And the only one.

pets.name: Mini Thor
pets.description: Powerful artillery of the Terran army. The Thor is always the first one in and the last one out!
pets.source: Promotion: StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty Collector's Edition

pets.name: Blue Mini Jouster
pets.description: Unlike its gold counterpart, the blue mini jouster takes a leisurely pace when jabbing its opponent's eyeballs.
pets.source:
Quest: Egg Wave

Zone: Mount Hyjal

pets.name: Gold Mini Jouster
pets.description: This critter is infamous for its ability to unleash a fast and furious eyeball jabbing.
pets.source:
Quest: Egg Wave

Zone: Mount Hyjal

pets.name: Personal World Destroyer
pets.description: Goblin engineering at its finest. Blueprints based on the massive fel reaver in Hellfire Peninsula.

pets.name: De-Weaponized Mechanical Companion
pets.description: The gold standard for sturdy gnomish design, this mechanical critter is the perfect companion for the lonely engineer on the go.

pets.name: Crawling Claw
pets.description: This appears to be nothing more than the paw of a small primate. A closer inspection shows that the hand has been dried by centuries of exposure to the sands of Uldum.

pets.name: Pebble
pets.description: An adventurous little elemental, Pebble escaped hungry gyreworms in the Crumbling Depths, braved the emptiness of the Twisting Nether, and ultimately found himself rescued from a mailbox.

pets.name: Fossilized Hatchling
pets.description: You stare at her, and she just stares right back. So clever; sometimes it seems as if she's figuring out how to open doors.

pets.name: Enchanted Lantern
pets.description: Reduces the likelihood of being eaten by monsters when you enter pitch-black places.

pets.name: Lil' Deathwing
pets.description: Nations tremble under his shadow - the Destroyer, the one-time Aspect of Earth, and the monster responsible for breaking Azeroth asunder.  Now in a convenient travel-size!

pets.name: Dark Phoenix Hatchling
pets.description: Fire hatchlings are born from the ashes of a phoenix. Dark hatchlings emerge from their shadows.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 300TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Rustberg Gull
pets.description: This bird is a salty veteran of the endless naval battles surrounding Tol Barad--a veteran whose grown plump from picking through the leftovers, that is.
pets.source:
Vendor: Quartermaster Brazie

Zone: Tol Barad Peninsula

Faction: Baradin's Wardens - Honored

Cost: 50

pets.name: Armadillo Pup
pets.description: Rolls into a protective ball when it feels threatened. Or when its mother calls.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 300TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Clockwork Gnome
pets.description: Thought to be an original construct of the titans, the clockwork gnome has some gears smaller than the eye can see.

pets.name: Fox Kit
pets.description: The fighting in Tol Barad has made it difficult to find these kits, and numerous would-be owners have decimated the fox population there as a result.
pets.source:
Drop: Baradin Fox

Zone: Tol Barad Peninsula

pets.name: Tiny Shale Spider
pets.description: The elemental shale spider is no true arachnid, but it has durability and ferocity that make it feared even in Deepholm.

pets.name: Guild Page
pets.description: Guild pages must be fearless since they are called upon to announce their guild's victories over the Horde in battle.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 300TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

Cooldown: 8 hrs

pets.name: Guild Page
pets.description: When a guild earns enough glory by defeating Alliance champions, some orcs will come to share the glory by serving the guild.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 300TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

Cooldown: 8 hrs

pets.name: Guild Herald
pets.description: When guilds have accumulated enough wealth, brave soldiers are often called to bear their standards.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 500TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

Cooldown: 4 hrs

pets.name: Guild Herald
pets.description: Wealthy guilds draw the attention of soldiers willing to carry their standards into battle.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 500TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

Cooldown: 4 hrs

pets.name: Landro's Lil' XT
pets.description: Always 'ready to play,' Landro's Lil' XT is almost indistinguishable from the original. Prone to tantrums and narcolepsy.

pets.name: Mr. Grubbs
pets.description: The grubs of the Plaguelands are a side effect of necromantic corruption and the massive number of corpses there. Mr. Grubbs is from a particularly acrobatic breed.
pets.source: World Drop: Eastern Plaguelands (requires Fiona's Lucky Charm)

pets.name: Tiny Flamefly
pets.description: After swarming around open lava pits during the day, these strange insects emit a fiery glow at night.
pets.source:
Quest: SEVEN! YUP!, Not Fireflies, Flameflies

Zone: Burning Steppes

pets.name: Scooter the Snail
pets.description: You'll find him in his shell, exactly where a snail has to be!

pets.name: Singing Sunflower
pets.description: This sweet flower will brighten your day with its warm smile and cheerful song! Also strong against undead.
pets.source:
Quest: Lawn of the Dead

Zone: Hillsbrad Foothills

pets.name: Magic Lamp
pets.description: Higitus figi- hockity pocki- abracadab- prestidig--oh, pinfeathers!

pets.name: Elementium Geode
pets.description: Often confused by miners as a rare gem, the geode initially makes its presence known by emitting melodic reverberations.
pets.source:
Drop: Elementium Vein, Rich Elementium Vein

Zone: Deepholm, Twilight Highlands, Uldum

pets.name: Deathy
pets.description: Deathwing's emergence transformed the whole of Azeroth; not even the ocean-dwelling murlocs were immune to his corrupt influence.

pets.name: Moonkin Hatchling
pets.description: Moonkin are blessed by Elune and spread nature's grace wherever they travel. The festive fowls are always in the mood for a dance.

pets.name: Lil' Ragnaros
pets.description: It's never too soon to summon this tiny aspect of the dread Firelord.

pets.name: Moonkin Hatchling
pets.description: The distinct roar of the moonkin is one of the most terrifying sounds in nature.

pets.name: Panther Cub
pets.description: It looked up at you with those huge black eyes and seemed to ask, 'Are you my mommy?'
pets.source:
Quest: Some Good Will Come

Zone: Northern Stranglethorn

pets.name: Landro's Lichling
pets.description: How the goblin Landro Longshot initially came into possession of the lichling remains a mystery, but he was all too eager to wager it in a game of cards.

pets.name: Nightsaber Cub
pets.description: Elune made nightsabers silver and black so they could meld into the shadows on a moonlit night.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Twilight of the Dragons

pets.name: Winterspring Cub
pets.description: Winterspring cubs are happiest when frolicking in freshly fallen snow.
pets.source:
Vendor: Michelle De Rum

Zone: Winterspring

Cost: 50TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Lashtail Hatchling
pets.description: Born in the jungles of Stranglethorn, unlucky raptor hatchlings are often captured by the Gurubashi and taken to the troll city of Zul'Gurub.
pets.source:
Quest: An Old Friend

Zone: Zul'gurub

pets.name: Legs
pets.description: Wild marsh walkers are dangerously aggressive, but they're loyal and affectionate if you manage to tame them.

pets.name: Pterrordax Hatchling
pets.description: Pterrordax eggs are incubated underneath the fossils of their forebears, allowing the hatchlings to absorb their ancestors' ferocity and intelligence.

pets.name: Voodoo Figurine
pets.description: Voodoo figurines were often empowered by flasks of mojo, troll sweat, and the flesh of tribal enemies.

pets.name: Guardian Cub
pets.description: Still a little clumsy, this tiny winged lion is learning how to be the best mount it can be!

pets.name: Cenarion Hatchling
pets.description: Not yet the fearsome creatures they grow to in adulthood, the Cenarion hatchlings have an almost harmless appearance that has caught novice trainers of the Cenarion Circle off guard.

pets.name: Hyjal Bear Cub
pets.description: The cubs of Hyjal suffered much during the Cataclysm. On the bright side, the devastation also led to their newfound love of heights and daredevil stunts.
pets.source:
Vendor: Varlan Highbough

Zone: Molten Front

Cost: 1500TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Crimson Lasher
pets.description: Native to the ashen soils of the Firelands, the lasher was transplanted to Azeroth with the help of the Guardians of Hyjal.
pets.source:
Vendor: Ayla Shadowstorm

Zone: Molten Front

Cost: 1500TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Feline Familiar
pets.description: Ride with the moon (and this furry, whiskered witch) in the dead of night!
pets.source:
World Event: Hallow's End

Vendor: Chub

Zone: Tirisfal Glades

Cost: 150



Vendor: Dorothy

Zone: Stormwind City

Cost: 150

pets.name: Lil' Tarecgosa
pets.description: A legendary member of the blue dragonflight.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 1500TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Creepy Crate
pets.description: Previous owners of the crate have reported the disappearance of other pets from their collection.

pets.name: Nuts
pets.description: Most squirrels hoard acorns for sustenance. Nuts, on the other hand, hoards acorns to stock its supply of ammunition.
pets.source:
Achievement: Petting Zoo

Category: Pet Battles

pets.name: Brilliant Kaliri
pets.description: One of the rarest creatures, this kaliri is set apart from others by its brilliant plumage and the lengths hunters will go to capture them.

pets.name: Purple Puffer
pets.description: You might think this fish out of water would be a weak opponent... until you see the intensity that lies within its protective bubble.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Throne of the Tides

pets.name: Murkablo
pets.description: When you're confronting Murkablo or any of the Prime Murlocs, possession of a soulstone is strongly advised.

pets.name: Darkmoon Monkey
pets.description: The monkeys of Azeroth are infamous tricksters, and these beloved companions of the Darkmoon Faire have taken that innate cunning to a whole new level.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Alliance Balloon
pets.description: Created to entertain children at the Darkmoon Faire, these magical balloons never lose their floatiness.

pets.name: Horde Balloon
pets.description: A magical wonder, these balloons will never deflate and are traditionally created in batches of ninety-nine.

pets.name: Gregarious Grell
pets.description: The grell are embodiments of the wild side of nature. Tame ones are very rare.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Crown of the Heavens

pets.name: Darkmoon Turtle
pets.description: This shelled reptile bravely protects the home on its back with an unwaveringly happy disposition.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Darkmoon Balloon
pets.description: It just floats along...
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Lumpy
pets.description: A stowaway from Greatfather Winter's workshop, this tiny elemental found himself trapped in a present that was stolen by the Abominable Greench.
pets.source: World Event: Feast of Winter Veil

pets.name: Darkmoon Tonk
pets.description: A favorite of children across Azeroth, this tough little toy can withstand even the most aggressive imagination.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Darkmoon Zeppelin
pets.description: Lacking the mines and rockets of its predecessor, this kid-friendly faire prize is a new favorite among Azeroth's children.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Sea Pony
pets.description: Despite its diminutive size, it is impossible to miss a sea pony cutting through the water.

pets.name: Lunar Lantern
pets.description: These magical lanterns are acquired at the Lunar Festival, which celebrates the defeat of the Burning Legion by the free races of Azeroth.
pets.source:
World Event: Lunar Festival

Vendor: Valadar Starsong

Zone: Moonglade

Cost: 50

pets.name: Festival Lantern
pets.description: The light from each lantern honors the soul of an ancestor spirit. During the Lunar Festival, these ghostly elders pass along their wisdom to the current generation.
pets.source:
World Event: Lunar Festival

Vendor: Valadar Starsong

Zone: Moonglade

Cost: 50

pets.name: Darkmoon Cub
pets.description: This snuggly kitten loves to frolic, but sometimes it seems to be chasing things that aren't really there.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Green Balloon
pets.source:
Vendor: Carl Goodup

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 10TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Yellow Balloon
pets.source:
Vendor: Carl Goodup

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 10TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Fetish Shaman
pets.description: Fetish shaman are empowered by the spirits of their fallen ancestors. These malevolent spirits are bound to the shaman's tribal spear. Control this spear, and you control the shaman.

pets.name: Soul of the Aspects
pets.description: The Soul of the Aspects is said to be possessed of mercurial moods ranging from stoic and deliberate to unpredictable and erratic, to loving and deeply pensive.

pets.name: Eye of the Legion
pets.description: Always watching. Always judging.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Timewalkers: War of the Anicents

pets.name: Black Lamb
pets.description: Offspring of the black sheep, the black lamb is only found in the forests of Elwynn.

pets.name: Rabbit
pets.description: When you have two rabbits, you'll often soon have three.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azshara, Blade's Edge Mountains, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Feralas, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Mulgore, Nagrand, Redridge Mountains, Silvermoon City, Silverpine Forest, Stonetalon Mountains, Stormwind City, Tirisfal Glades, Western Plaguelands, Westfall, Wetlands

pets.name: Squirrel
pets.description: Most people do not know the difference between a squirrel and a chipmunk. Most don't care.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ammen Vale, Ashenvale, Azshara, Blade's Edge Mountains, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Elwynn Forest, Feralas, Gilneas, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Loch Modan, Magisters' Terrace, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Nagrand, Ruins of Gilneas, Sholazar Basin, Silverpine Forest, Spires of Arak, Stormwind City, Teldrassil, Terokkar Forest, Tol Barad Peninsula, Twilight Highlands, Val'sharah, Well of Eternity, Western Plaguelands, Westfall, Wetlands, Zul'Aman

pets.name: Bucktooth Flapper
pets.description: It's hard to know what's more dangerous: the teeth or the tail.

pets.name: Porcupette
pets.description: Despite the name you should absolutely never, ever pet it.

pets.name: Raccoon Kit
pets.description: Aptly named 'ring bandits' by the pandaren, raccoons have dexterous paws and insatiable appetites for shiny objects, especially jewelry.

pets.name: Eternal Strider
pets.description: It seems like a trick to the eyes, but the eternal strider can walk across water, its small feet never breaking the surface.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Otter Pup
pets.description: The thick pelt of the otter makes it adaptable to any climate, but it particularly prefers frigid waters where abalone is plentiful.

pets.name: Mouse
pets.description: It seems that mice are completely incapable of resisting cheese even in the face of imprisonment, injury, or death.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Grizzly Hills, Mulgore, Netherstorm, Westfall, Wetlands

pets.name: Prairie Dog
pets.description: Distinct from their tree dwelling cousins, these ground squirrels make their homes on the plains of Azeroth and beyond.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Arathi Highlands, Mulgore, Nagrand, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Thunder Bluff, Westfall

pets.name: Snake
pets.description: Due to recent accidents, the goblin cartels have prohibited anyone from bringing snakes on a zeppelin.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Dustwallow Marsh, Eversong Woods, Feralas, Ghostlands, Howling Fjord, Loch Modan, Nagrand, Northern Stranglethorn, Sholazar Basin, Silverpine Forest, Terokkar Forest, Westfall, Zangarmarsh, Zul'Drak

pets.name: Shore Crab
pets.description: These arthropods line many Azerothian shores and seek to fulfill their one true desire: to pinch.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azshara, Borean Tundra, Howling Fjord, Krasarang Wilds, Nagrand (Draenor), Twilight Highlands, Westfall

pets.name: Tiny Harvester
pets.description: The tiny harvester collects weeds and small grains that the larger reapers may have missed.

pets.name: Deer
pets.description: When they look into those big brown eyes, some hunters have a hard time pulling the trigger. So they shoot from a distance.

pets.name: Mountain Cottontail
pets.description: Mountain cottontails can leap up a steep incline with speed you would not believe.

pets.name: Redridge Rat
pets.description: The rats in Redridge grow fat from feasting on the bounty of the village larders.

pets.name: Cockroach
pets.description: They were here long before us and will be here long after we are gone.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Burning Steppes, Eastern Plaguelands, Gorgrond, Icecrown, Iron Docks, The Hinterlands, Twilight Highlands, Un'Goro Crater, Wetlands

pets.name: Sheep
pets.description: "Little Bo Peep has lost her sheep, and doesn't know where to find them. Leave them alone, and they'll come OH MY GOD THEY'RE INSIDE THE HOUSE!"

pets.name: Fledgling Buzzard
pets.description: Always wear a helm in the Redridge Mountains. Buzzards view humanoid hair as excellent nesting material.

pets.name: Dusk Spiderling
pets.description: Native to Duskwood, these eight-legged critters are often used as ingredients in alchemy potions.

pets.name: Skunk
pets.description: Skunks are known as solitary creatures for reasons which are hopefully obvious.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ammen Vale, Azshara, Bloodmyst Isle, Duskwood, Gilneas, Howling Fjord, Nagrand (Draenor), Terokkar Forest

pets.name: Black Rat
pets.description: While many people believe black cats to be bad luck, black rats are held in higher esteem.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Badlands, Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Eastern Plaguelands, Thousand Needles, Twilight Highlands, Western Plaguelands, Wetlands

pets.name: Rat Snake
pets.description: Years ago, humans introduced these reptiles into Duskwood to cull the local rat population.

pets.name: Widow Spiderling
pets.description: Widow spiderlings have plenty of time to explore Duskwood once they take care of their pesky family commitments.

pets.name: Strand Crab
pets.description: The low tide reveals the colonies of strand crabs and the sound of their clicking dance as they feed upon small creatures hidden in the sand.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Darkshore, Dragonblight, Dun Morogh, Gilneas, Kezan, Northern Stranglethorn, Spires of Arak, Swamp of Sorrows, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Lost Isles

pets.name: Swamp Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in wet, muddy areas and feed on Sorrowmoss nectar.

pets.name: Parrot
pets.description: Parrots can mimic speech, but have difficulty with meaningful conversation.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Northern Stranglethorn, Swamp of Sorrows, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Long-tailed Mole
pets.description: Thought by many to be nothing more than the subject of children's nursery rhymes, the long-tailed mole is very much real.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Dun Morogh, Northern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Tree Python
pets.description: Stranglethorn's Gurubashi trolls often capture these powerful beasts to keep as pets... or to cook as meals.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Northern Stranglethorn, Tanaan Jungle, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Beetle
pets.description: A hardy insect that can dwell in just about any climate, the beetle is known to thrive on battlefields after the fighting has ended.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Badlands, Eastern Plaguelands, Felwood, Northern Stranglethorn, Silithus, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Forest Spiderling
pets.description: This vicious species weaves elaborate webs throughout the dense jungles of Stranglethorn Vale.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Highmountain, Northern Stranglethorn, Shadowmoon Valley, The Cape of Stranglethorn

pets.name: Lizard Hatchling
pets.description: If a female lizard does not lay her clutch in a well camouflaged area, her eggs will likely be devoured by Lashtail Raptors.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Northern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

pets.name: Polly
pets.description: Parrots can't get enough of the fresh fish the Bloodscalp trolls eat. They're less interested in dry flatbreads.

pets.name: Wharf Rat
pets.description: Just like the rough and tumble sailors who live dockside, the wharf rats are feral, violent creatures.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Iron Docks, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Tol Barad Peninsula

pets.name: Baby Ape
pets.description: Young apes quickly learn to hang from branches with their feet, leaving both hands free to fling objects at interlopers.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: The Cape of Stranglethorn

Weather: Rain

pets.name: Spider
pets.description: The most common of the arachnid family, these critters spin their webs in nearly every corner of Azeroth.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ahn'kahet: The Old Kingdom, Azjol-Nerub, Azshara, Black Temple, Blasted Lands, Drak'Tharon Keep, Dun Morogh, Dustwallow Marsh, Eastern Plaguelands, Elwynn Forest, Ghostlands, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Halls of Reflection, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Icecrown Citadel, Karazhan, Naxxramas, Orgrimmar, Pit of Saron, Ruins of Gilneas, Shadowmoon Valley (Draenor), Stonetalon Mountains, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, The Culling of Stratholme, The Forge of Souls, The Hinterlands, The Storm Peaks, The Violet Hold, Tirisfal Glades, Utgarde Keep, Utgarde Pinnacle, Winterspring, Zul'Aman, Zul'Drak

pets.name: Scorpid
pets.description: Venom capable of killing creatures up to 100 times its own body weight.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Blade's Edge Mountains, Blasted Lands, Burning Steppes, Eastern Plaguelands, Hellfire Peninsula, Orgrimmar, Shadowmoon Valley, Silithus, Thousand Needles, Twilight Highlands

pets.name: Fire Beetle
pets.description: Drawn to heat and the smell of smoke, the fire beetle's diet consists of ash.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Blasted Lands, Burning Steppes, Mount Hyjal, Searing Gorge, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Scorpling
pets.description: Despite its snapping claws and venom-dripping tail, it is the bite of the diminutive scorpling that is the greatest threat.

pets.name: Rat
pets.description: The intrepid archaeologist Harrison Jones has a well documented fear of rats.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ammen Vale, Arathi Basin, Arathi Highlands, Ashenvale, Azshara, Bloodmyst Isle, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Desolace, Drak'Tharon Keep, Dun Morogh, Frostfire Ridge, Ghostlands, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Karazhan, Loch Modan, Nagrand, Naxxramas, Ruins of Gilneas, Scarlet Monastery, Shattrath City, Silverpine Forest, Spires of Arak, Stonetalon Mountains, Stormwind City, Sunken Temple, Swamp of Sorrows, Terokkar Forest, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Culling of Stratholme, The Deadmines, The Hinterlands, The Lost Isles, The Shattered Halls, The Violet Hold, Timeless Isle, Tirisfal Glades, Tanaan Jungle

pets.name: Water Snake
pets.description: Brought to Orgrimmar aboard merchant ships, these short-lived reptiles are considered pests by the city's residents.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Durotar, Northern Stranglethorn, Orgrimmar, Swamp of Sorrows, Twilight Highlands, Wetlands

pets.name: Small Frog
pets.description: This is a small frog.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Arathi Highlands, Darnassus, Desolace, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Ghostlands, Loch Modan, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, Zangarmarsh

pets.name: Toad
pets.description: The song of late summer nights is the song of toads.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ashenvale,  Durotar, Dustwallow Marsh, Eversong Woods, Felwood, Ghostlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Nagrand, Orgrimmar, Silverpine Forest, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, Twilight Highlands, Wetlands

pets.name: Crimson Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in humid, tropical areas and feed on Kingsblood nectar.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Northern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

pets.name: Moccasin
pets.description: When hunting or evading predators, this snake can travel on the surface of water for short distances.

pets.name: Lava Crab
pets.description: The thick exoskeleton of this adaptable arthropod allows it to thrive in harsh environments.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Burning Steppes, Searing Gorge

pets.name: Roach
pets.description: A nuisance to most, roaches' incredible survivability sets them apart from other species.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ashenvale, Azshara, Desolace, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Howling Fjord, Icecrown Citadel, Kezan, Loch Modan, Northern Stranglethorn, Razorfen Downs, Redridge Mountains, Stonetalon Mountains, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Culling of Stratholme, Thousand Needles, Tirisfal Glades

pets.name: Ash Viper
pets.description: This ill-tempered snake species makes its home around the fiery molten pits of the Burning Steppes.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Burning Steppes, Shadowmoon Valley

pets.name: Ash Spiderling
pets.description: The rock-hard carapaces of these spiders allow them to survive in the Searing Gorge's blistering heat.

pets.name: Molten Hatchling
pets.description: These blisteringly hot spiders camouflage themselves by blending in with oozing magma.

pets.name: Lava Beetle
pets.description: Beetles in the Burning Steppes roll magma into tiny balls and eat them once they cool off.

pets.name: Gold Beetle
pets.description: Tiny, autonomous machines created by the Titans to clean and maintain their mighty edifices.

pets.name: Rattlesnake
pets.description: Wildhammer dwarves train young gryphons by sending them out to hunt rattlesnakes in the Twilight Highlands.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Badlands, Tanaris, Twilight Highlands

pets.name: Stripe-Tailed Scorpid
pets.description: Less venomous but more aggressive than other breeds of scorpion.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Badlands, Tanaris, Terokkar Forest

pets.name: Spiky Lizard
pets.description: The coloration of the spiky lizard allows it to blend in seamlessly with the desert sands of Silithus.

pets.name: Ram
pets.description: When a ram lowers his head, it means he's preparing to charge. Or he could just be tired.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Arathi Highlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Loch Modan, Ruins of Gilneas, Wetlands

pets.name: Little Black Ram
pets.description: These rams hone their fighting skills by head-butting twigs and saplings near Loch Modan.

pets.name: King Snake
pets.description: This snake is often seen sunning on the exposed rocks high in the Badlands.

pets.name: Restless Shadeling
pets.description: These creatures are silent, save for the occasional sigh of otherworldly despair.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: Deadwind Pass

Time: Early Morning

pets.name: Snow Cub
pets.description: The thick snow near Dun Morogh acts as camouflage for snow cubs learning to hunt.

pets.name: Alpine Hare
pets.description: The alpine hare can burrow into the permafrost and hibernate for weeks or even months.

pets.name: Irradiated Roach
pets.description: Most creatures cannot withstand a fraction of the harsh conditions that roaches can thrive in.

pets.name: Grasslands Cottontail
pets.description: Despite their idyllic surroundings, grasslands cottontails hop at surprising speed when evading their pursuers.

pets.name: Tiny Twister
pets.description: Twisters delight in sneaking up on unsuspecting creatures and surprising them with gusts up their nostrils.

pets.name: Jade Oozeling
pets.description: Jade Oozelings glow in the dark, making them a welcome sight to workers in pitch-black mineshafts.

pets.name: Fawn
pets.description: Pay attention to deer crossings. Even a fawn will total a goblin trike.

pets.name: Hare
pets.description: A carrot, a box, a stick, and some string. Wait a few hours and you'll have a hare.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Arathi Highlands, Durotar, The Hinterlands

pets.name: Brown Marmot
pets.description: Distinct from their Azerothian relatives, these critters of Outland make their home in Blade's Edge Mountains.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Blade's Edge Mountains, Gorgrond, The Hinterlands

pets.name: Maggot
pets.description: The preferred habitat of this creature is woodland areas where it can safely complete its metamorphosis.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ashenvale, Ghostlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, The Hinterlands, Tirisfal Glades, Tanaan Jungle

pets.name: Red-Tailed Chipmunk
pets.description: According to the tales of the night elves, the first red-tailed chipmunk was colored so after the theft and consumption of a sacred apple.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Darnassus, Desolace, Hillsbrad Foothills, Talador, Teldrassil

pets.name: Infested Bear Cub
pets.description: Infested cubs still listen for the telltale buzzing of bees even though they can no longer taste honey.

pets.name: Undercity Rat
pets.description: Even the rats of Lordaeron fell to the apothecaries' plague, chewing upon the tainted flesh of the dead.

pets.name: Blighted Squirrel
pets.description: Undead squirrels have acquired a taste for the strange berries and mushrooms that now grow in Silverpine Forest.

pets.name: Blighthawk
pets.description: Curiously, this hawk uses its razor-sharp talons to peel the bark off trees as it searches for bugs, even though it has no need for sustenance.

pets.name: Festering Maggot
pets.description: It can swallow three times its own body weight in blood.

pets.name: Lost of Lordaeron
pets.description: These small spirits find their undead neighbors to be poor company, so they typically wander Tirisfal Glades alone.

pets.name: Cat
pets.description: After centuries of domestication, these furry critters inhabit nearly every human nation in the Eastern Kingdoms.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Arathi Highlands, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Netherstorm, Silvermoon City

pets.name: Ruby Sapling
pets.description: Small elemental saplings grow into treants, fierce defenders of forests and groves.

pets.name: Larva
pets.description: This new arrival to Azeroth was spawned a short time ago. It seeks to thrive while awaiting its next phase of evolution.

pets.name: Jacob the Test Seagull
pets.description: [DEBUG] This pet comes from the magical Test Land where it frolics all day in fields of structs.
pets.source:
Vendor: Quartermaster Brazie

Zone: Tol Barad Peninsula

Faction: Baradin's Wardens - Honored

pets.name: Spirit Crab
pets.description: The souls of slain crabs seek vengeance against the murlocs who ate them.

pets.name: Grey Moth
pets.description: You can easily locate moths if you wear expensive garments near Ammen Vale. They can't resist the delicious taste of high fashion.

pets.name: Ravager Hatchling
pets.description: These voracious carnivores first arrived on Azeroth aboard the draenei's dimensional fortress, the Exodar.

pets.name: Spiny Lizard
pets.description: The children of Orgrimmar frequently capture these lizards as pets.  The adults of Orgrimmar frequently step on them.

pets.name: Dung Beetle
pets.description: A desert dwelling forager attracted to areas rich with dung.

pets.name: Creepy Crawly
pets.description: These beetles often make their homes in quarries abandoned by the Horde war machine in Durotar.

pets.name: Twilight Beetle
pets.description: An enigmatic species, said to feed off the chaotic energies of the Old Gods.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azshara, Deepholm, Mount Hyjal

pets.name: Twilight Spider
pets.description: Twisted by the Twilight Hammer's dark magic, these sinister critters are known to feed on their own young.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azshara, Deepholm, Twilight Highlands

pets.name: Robo-Chick
pets.description: Originally built by an irate goblin to annoy neighbors with an early morning wake-up call.

pets.name: Rabid Nut Varmint 5000
pets.description: Considered by most to be a significant improvement to the 4000 series, there were nonetheless serious concerns about the amount of heat they produced.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azshara, Stonetalon Mountains, Winterspring

pets.name: Turquoise Turtle
pets.description: Turtles are feared by the naga, who consider them bad luck and give them a wide berth on the shores of Azshara.

pets.name: Cheetah Cub
pets.description: These playful feline cubs practice their hunting skills by stalking each other through the Barrens.

pets.name: Giraffe Calf
pets.description: The barbaric centaur over-hunted giraffes for decades, but it was the tauren who saved this species from extinction.

pets.name: Gazelle
pets.description: Most people only see gazelles from the rear.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Desolace, Mulgore, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens

pets.name: Gazelle Fawn
pets.description: Young gazelles quickly learn to flee when they hear the war cries of tauren hunters in Mulgore.  They don't hear the good hunters, unfortunately.

pets.name: Forest Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in cool, forested areas and feed on Mageroyal nectar.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Ashenvale, Darnassus, Desolace, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Teldrassil

pets.name: Elfin Rabbit
pets.description: Their proximity to the magic of the elves has caused some of them unnatural long life. And in some elfin rabbits...stranger things.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Darnassus, Desolace, Mount Hyjal, Teldrassil

pets.name: Topaz Shale Hatchling
pets.description: Prized by gem crafters, the undamaged carapace of a topaz hatchling can be used to create stunning inlays for rings and bracelets.

pets.name: Rock Viper
pets.description: Long ago, Mount Hyjal's druids tempered this species to live in peace alongside the region's other creatures.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Blade's Edge Mountains, Desolace, Mount Hyjal, Silithus

pets.name: Horny Toad
pets.description: There are many scholars who question whether it is a toad or not.

pets.name: Desert Spider
pets.description: This cunning species tunnels beneath Uldum and erupts from the ground to ensnare its prey.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Desolace, Silithus, Tanaris, Uldum

pets.name: Stone Armadillo
pets.description: When these sleepy critters aren't snoozing, they use their massive claws to dig for tasty insect snacks.

pets.name: Mule Deer
pets.description: It's called a mule because of its big ears. Also been known to transport black market bloodthistle over the border to Quel'Thalas.

pets.name: Alpine Chipmunk
pets.description: Many an explorer has been entranced by the adorable nature of the alpine chipmunk, failing to notice its small teeth on frostbitten digits.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Highmountain, Mount Hyjal, Stonetalon Mountains, Winterspring

pets.name: Coral Snake
pets.description: Brave assassins sometimes capture these critters to use their highly toxic venom to poison weapons.

pets.name: Spawn of Onyxia
pets.description: These vicious fire-breathing whelps escaped Onyxia's lair and fled into the surrounding region. Handle with extreme caution.

pets.name: Sand Kitten
pets.description: Originally bred by the Sandfury trolls as pets, these feral and savage felines prowl the deserts of Tanaris.

pets.name: Stinkbug
pets.description: A desert-dwelling insect which defends its eggs by spraying a foul, ogrelike scent.

pets.name: Shimmershell Snail
pets.description: Hunts for food just below the water's surface on the coast of Darkshore.

pets.name: Silithid Hatchling
pets.description: These hatchlings entertain themselves by clacking their mandibles together in increasingly complex rhythms.

pets.name: Frog
pets.description: For every frog, a prince and princess in waiting.

pets.name: Rusty Snail
pets.description: Don't let their lack of a face fool you--these slimy critters are angry and just itching for a fight.

pets.name: Tainted Cockroach
pets.description: Even cockroaches were not strong enough to withstand the foul seepage of demonic corruption.

pets.name: Tainted Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in corrupted woodlands and feed on Purple Lotus nectar.

pets.name: Tainted Rat
pets.description: There are some things too dirty even for rats.

pets.name: Minfernal
pets.description: These ill-tempered constructs of flame and rage sometimes rise from the remains of larger infernals who fall in battle.

pets.name: Spotted Bell Frog
pets.description: The dwarven explorer who first discovered the spotted bell frog could not decide between naming it after the unique spot pattern or the sound of the frog's mating ritual. She chose both.

pets.name: Silky Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in the shadow of Nordrassil and feed on Stormvine nectar.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Diemetradon Hatchling
pets.description: Diemetradons abandon their hatchlings in Un'Goro Crater to fend for themselves. Only the strongest survive.

pets.name: Twilight Iguana
pets.description: Although most reptiles enjoy basking in sunlight, these scaly beasts love bathing in the glow of Azeroth's twin moons.

pets.name: Venomspitter Hatchling
pets.description: These eight-legged critters have lurked in the shadowy cliffs of the Stonetalon Mountains for millennia.

pets.name: Crested Owl
pets.description: Many owls nest high in the stone structures of Darnassus, hunting any pests that enter the night elves' city.

pets.name: Darkshore Cub
pets.description: The fur of the darkshore bears owes to the almost perpetual gloom they live in, and their vision in the darkness is uncanny.

pets.name: Tiny Bog Beast
pets.description: These small elementals cling to the backs of larger mire beasts, picking off tasty bugs and mites.

pets.name: Rabbot
pets.description: Many a young gnomish inventor has made up for the death of a beloved pet by creating a mechanical friend in its image.

pets.name: Sidewinder
pets.description: Native to Azeroth's desert regions, these resilient reptiles can survive for weeks without water.

pets.name: Scarab Hatchling
pets.description: Spawn of the nefarious Shrieker Scarabs of Ahn'Qiraj, the hatchlings are much more docile (and quiet) than their parents.

pets.name: Qiraji Guardling
pets.description: The squeaks used by these tiny insectoids may sound cute, but they're actually screaming for your death.

pets.name: Flayer Youngling
pets.description: A brash fel orc once tried to enslave these critters as his personal soldiers. Pieces of him are still scattered across Outland.

pets.name: Sporeling Sprout
pets.description: These pudgy little beings often get themselves into trouble while hunting down their favorite snack: glow caps.

pets.name: Warpstalker Hatchling
pets.description: After hatching, these twisted reptiles devour the weaker members of their clutches as an act of dominance.

pets.name: Clefthoof Runt
pets.description: For ogres, comparing a female's hair to a clefthoof's shaggy coat is a term of great endearment.

pets.name: Fel Flame
pets.description: Born from demonic magic, these petulant little entities corrupt everything they touch with foul energies.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Shadowmoon Valley, Tanaan Jungle

pets.name: Fledgling Nether Ray
pets.description: Adult nether rays are relatively docile, but their younglings are short-tempered and highly energetic beasts.

pets.name: Devouring Maggot
pets.description: Howling Fjord teems with the ever shifting cycle of life. When a creature dies, its body is quickly consumed by maggots, which in turn pass those nutrients on to a number of other creatures.

pets.name: Turkey
pets.description: A key food source during the Feast of Winter Veil.

pets.name: Scalded Basilisk Hatchling
pets.description: This grumpy species of basilisk roams the Blade's Edge Mountains, avoiding contact with other critters whenever possible.

pets.name: Fjord Worg Pup
pets.description: There's an old vrykul saying that goes, 'Let sleeping worgs lie, unless you don't want your face anymore.'

pets.name: Oily Slimeling
pets.description: These living blobs of ooze lack even the most rudimentary form of intelligence, but that doesn't mean they can't be your friend.

pets.name: Stunted Shardhorn
pets.description: The fierce wolvar hunt these ill-tempered brutes for their horns, which are then carved into talismans and other trinkets.

pets.name: Imperial Eagle Chick
pets.description: The taunka collect the feathers of these noble birds of prey to use in crude fortunetelling ceremonies.

pets.name: Water Waveling
pets.description: The trolls of Zul'Drak inadvertently created these little beings while summoning water elementals to fight the Scourge.

pets.name: Tundra Penguin
pets.description: Tundra penguins often gather in large groups on the ice for protection against aquatic threats. Unfortunately this makes them easy prey for humanoid hunters seeking meat, skins and other achievements.

pets.name: Dragonbone Hatchling
pets.description: These skulking little creatures hatch in nests built around the ancient dragon bones of central Northrend.

pets.name: Scourged Whelpling
pets.description: Kel'Thuzad once nursed a plague-infected whelp to adulthood, feeding it only the finest liquefied remains.

pets.name: Grotto Vole
pets.description: Grotto voles are often confused with mice. Never twice.

pets.name: Carrion Rat
pets.description: Where there is carrion, there will always be rats.

pets.name: Fire-Proof Roach
pets.description: The outer member of the roaches' eggs protect the larva from incineration. It is here in incubation that they gain the ability to resist the fire and heat of the volcanic climate.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Frostfire Ridge, Mount Hyjal

pets.name: Mac Frog
pets.description: Flamboyantly colored and more exuberant than most frogs.

pets.name: Locust
pets.description: When the locusts swarm, you can hear nothing but the sound of their wings.

pets.name: Oasis Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell along desert streams, wells or watering holes and feed on Whiptail nectar.

pets.name: Leopard Scorpid
pets.description: Loves to rest inside footwear of unsuspecting travelers during the night.

pets.name: Tol'vir Scarab
pets.description: Carrion feeders often found in large numbers within ancient unearthed tombs; they can survive long periods of time without feeding.

pets.name: Nordrassil Wisp
pets.description: During the Third War, thousands of these mystical beings annihilated the demon lord Archimonde.

pets.name: Wildhammer Gryphon Hatchling
pets.description: Too afraid to attempt flying until thrown from a great height.

pets.name: Yellow-Bellied Marmot
pets.description: Distinct from their plain dwelling relatives, these critters make their homes amidst the war-torn Twilight Highlands.

pets.name: Highlands Mouse
pets.description: The mice of the highlands, perhaps twisted by the Twilight's Hammer, are aggressive and fight for dominance between each other.

pets.name: Twilight Fiendling
pets.description: Demonstrating that a little evil goes a long way, this fiendling uses its razor-sharp teeth and gaping maw to devour anything in its path.

pets.name: Stowaway Rat
pets.description: In the lean times when adrift at sea, the sight of a rat was a welcome one.

pets.name: Crimson Shale Hatchling
pets.description: Through experimentation, the mages of Dalaran have discovered that the powered remains of a crimson shale spider will greatly increase the conflagration of their fire spells.

pets.name: Deepholm Cockroach
pets.description: The cockroaches of Deepholm can burrow into stone itself to make their nests.

pets.name: Crystal Beetle
pets.description: A cousin to the Twilight Beetle, this insect has learned to feed on crystals which resonate with ancient energies.

pets.name: Nether Faerie Dragon
pets.description: Much like other faerie dragons, these playful and mystical flyers are born with a natural defense against magic.

pets.name: Arctic Fox Kit
pets.description: During frigid nights in the Storm Peaks, these critters use their fluffy tails as a blanket to stay warm.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: The Storm Peaks

Weather: Snow

pets.name: Crimson Geode
pets.description: Therazane wore these spunky crimson elementals as jewelry before the azure craze swept through Deepholm.

pets.name: Sea Gull
pets.description: The seagull is a coastal scavenger often found near the docks.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Frostwall, Krasarang Wilds, Talador, Tanaris

pets.name: Coral Adder
pets.description: The coral adder's venom is so deadly that one bite has been known to kill a full grown kodo beast.

pets.name: Emerald Turtle
pets.description: It is difficult to believe that Shen-zin Su, on whose shell rests all of the Wandering Isle, began life as a tiny emerald turtle.

pets.name: Jungle Darter
pets.description: In the jungle, every leaf could conceal a frog. Stop to check and it could be long gone.

pets.name: Mirror Strider
pets.description: When preparing to travel to distant locations, Pandaren will traditionally capture a mirror strider and safely relocate it to another body of water.

pets.name: Temple Snake
pets.description: The Jade Forest's pandaren consider these reptiles distant relatives of the revered Jade Serpent, Yu'lon.

pets.name: Silkbead Snail
pets.description: Hides in shell to escape claws of nearby crabs.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Gorgrond, Spires of Arak, Talador, The Jade Forest

pets.name: Garden Frog
pets.description: One of the stranger nuisances to horticulturalists, garden frogs can cause untold damage to gardens.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Azsuna, Highmountain, The Jade Forest

pets.name: Masked Tanuki
pets.description: There's a raging debate over whether tanukis are raccoons or dogs, but the distinction seems trivial when they're gnawing on your femur.

pets.name: Grove Viper
pets.description: The Jade Forest's mountain hozen fear these venomous reptiles and often hunt them out of pure spite.

pets.name: Spirebound Crab
pets.description: These tiny arthropods are Pandaria natives that call the area of the Windless Isle their home.

pets.name: Sandy Petrel
pets.description: The sandy petrel flies high above the Windless Isle, safe from landbound predators.

pets.name: Bat
pets.description: This foreboding creature stalks the night skies of the Eastern Plaguelands, feeding on carrion.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Eastern Plaguelands, Mount Hyjal, Tirisfal Glades

pets.name: Infected Squirrel
pets.description: More horrifying than its appearance is that the infected squirrels of the Plaguelands no longer hoard nuts, instead collecting rotten, decaying flesh.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Bloodmyst Isle, Eastern Plaguelands, Silverpine Forest

pets.name: Infected Fawn
pets.description: Only the dimwitted or insane would mount an infected deer head on their wall. The good news is they'll fit right in with their new undead friends.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Bloodmyst Isle, Eastern Plaguelands, Silverpine Forest

pets.name: Shore Crawler
pets.description: Only found on the shores of Kezan, this lovely sea creature can be a bit snarky.

pets.name: Gilnean Raven
pets.description: Quoth the raven: the last word you said. It gets old.

pets.name: Emerald Boa
pets.description: Hunted for its beautifully patterned skin, this majestic species thrives alongside Azeroth's lush rivers.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Uldum, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Ash Lizard
pets.description: The ash lizard gets its name from the way its shed skin looks, with an appearance like burnt cinders.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Mount Hyjal, Un'Goro Crater

pets.name: Mountain Skunk
pets.description: The mountain skunk is most famous for its adventurous nature. No really, that is what it is famous for.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Grizzly Hills, Stonetalon Mountains, The Storm Peaks, Wetlands, Winterspring

pets.name: Crystal Spider
pets.description: These strange critters glimmer like ice, allowing them to hide among Winterspring's snowy expanses.

pets.name: Adder
pets.description: Unlike other snakes that actively hunt, these crafty reptiles hide in thick foliage and ambush their prey.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Blasted Lands, Dun Morogh, Durotar, Grimrail Depot, Hellfire Peninsula, Nagrand, Northern Barrens, Northern Stranglethorn, Southern Barrens, Spires of Arak

pets.name: Skittering Cavern Crawler
pets.description: These arachnids use their razor-sharp legs to carve tunnels in the solid rock of the Blade's Edge Mountains.

pets.name: Nether Roach
pets.description: The nether roach has adapted to the cold vacuum of space and requires no air to survive. Inside it bears almost no resemblance to a common roach.

pets.name: Borean Marmot
pets.description: Distinct from their cousins found in warmer climes, these hardy critters make their homes in the icy wastes of Northrend.

pets.name: Snowshoe Hare
pets.description: With the extra large surface area of their legs, snowshoe hares are able to effortlessly hop along the snow while their pursuers get bogged down in the drifts.

pets.name: Arctic Hare
pets.description: The heart of an arctic hare beats twice as fast as a common hare.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Borean Tundra, Dragonblight, The Storm Peaks, Zul'Drak

pets.name: Fjord Rat
pets.description: If not for being extremely accident prone, the fjord rat might take over the world.

pets.name: Highlands Turkey
pets.description: Capable of flying, unlike domesticated types.

pets.name: Chicken
pets.description: Tends to avoid crossing roads, regardless of motivations.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Elwynn Forest, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Redridge Mountains, Terokkar Forest, Tirisfal Glades, Westfall, Wetlands

pets.name: Grizzly Squirrel
pets.description: In the deep forest, even the small creatures must have the ferocity to fend for themselves.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Grizzly Hills, Twilight Highlands

pets.name: Huge Toad
pets.description: This is a huge toad.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Hillsbrad Foothills, Swamp of Sorrows, Twilight Highlands, Zul'Drak

pets.name: Biletoad
pets.description: The rumors of the medicinal uses of the biletoad were believed to have been started by a particularly mischievous apothecary.

pets.name: Terrible Turnip
pets.description: And you thought turnips at the dinner table were bad.
pets.source:
Drop: World Drop

Zone: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Tiny Goldfish
pets.description: This bubble is way worse than a tank.
pets.source:
Vendor: Nat Pagle

Zone: Krasarang Wilds

Faction: The Anglers - Honored

Cost: 250TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Sand Scarab
pets.description: Easily mistaken for a common beetle, the sting of a sand scarab will quickly clear up the misconception should you be unlucky enough to be stung by one.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Tomb of the Forgotten

pets.name: Elayna
pets.description: Elayna is found only within snowstorms and can usually be found by luring her out with a notepad and promises of Wiki pages.

pets.name: Lucky Quilen Cub
pets.description: Offspring of the Imperial Quilen.
pets.source: Promotion: Mists of Pandaria Collector's Edition Pet

pets.name: Stormwind Rat
pets.description: Unnoticed but to cats and ratcatchers, when Deathwing descended upon Stormwind all the rats beat a hasty retreat from the city. Only of late have they returned.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Elwynn Forest, Stormwind City

pets.name: Shy Bandicoon
pets.description: A goblin alchemist once claimed that the bite of this raccoon gave him the gift of prophecy. Turns out, it was just rabies.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Jungle Grub
pets.description: These little green grubs are native to wilds of Pandaria. Its verdant coloration camouflages it from would-be predators.

pets.name: Summit Kid
pets.description: You'll often find them perched high atop impossibly high and remote stone outcroppings. There are few creatures as sure of foot.

pets.name: Kuitan Mongoose
pets.description: The mongoose is prized for its ability to drive off poisonous snakes.  Rikk-tikk-tikki-tikki-tchk!

pets.name: Jumping Spider
pets.description: This terrifying and highly venomous species leaps onto its prey from the Jade Forest's dense canopy.

pets.name: Leopard Tree Frog
pets.description: The leopard tree frog was named for the way it pounces from branch to branch.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Gorgrond, The Jade Forest

pets.name: Masked Tanuki Pup
pets.description: Many young raccoons rail against their strict curfews, complaining that dawn is way too early to go to bed.

pets.name: Amorous Rooster
pets.description: There are few things more annoying for a farmer to find underfoot than a rooster looking for love.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of Four Winds

pets.name: Bandicoon
pets.description: The taciturn bandicoon's diet consists mostly of apples.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Bandicoon Kit
pets.description: Some druids say pandaren and raccoons are distant cousins, but never when a pandaren can hear them.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Malayan Quillrat
pets.description: Many believe that the quillrat is able to shoot its spines at aggressors.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds, Krasarang Wilds

pets.name: Malayan Quillrat Pup
pets.description: Although the wounds caused by the young quillrat are seldom fatal, most predators seek easier prey.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Marsh Fiddler
pets.description: Known to feast on the tasty plants in Valley of the Four Winds.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Sifang Otter
pets.description: The sifang otter lives near rivers and is normally friendly and playful.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Sifang Otter Pup
pets.description: Otters swim by propelling themselves with their powerful tails and flexing their long bodies. Very fast in the water.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Softshell Snapling
pets.description: Softshell turtle meat is considered a delicacy and is the key ingredient in soothing turtle bisque.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Feverbite Hatchling
pets.description: The common folk remedy to a feverbite hatchling's bite is to dance wildly and try to sweat out the toxins before they can take hold.

pets.name: Wild Silkworm
pets.description: Prized for their ability to spin cocoons of silk, in the wild, to the untrained eye, they can be difficult to discern.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Amethyst Spiderling
pets.description: A rarity among arachnids, these non-venomous critters feed solely on plants and fruit.

pets.name: Savory Beetle
pets.description: The most delicious of the beetle family.

pets.name: Luyu Moth
pets.description: A daring, narcissist insect willing to brave any threat in its pursuit of the spotlight.

pets.name: Mei Li Sparkler
pets.description: Feeds on small leaves and grass when full grown.

pets.name: Spiny Terrapin
pets.description: Angering a spiny terrapin will cause it to withdraw into its shell and begin to spin wildly towards an attacker.

pets.name: Alpine Foxling
pets.description: Burrows deep into snowbanks to hide from predators.

pets.name: Alpine Foxling Kit
pets.description: Occasionally sneaks bites of food from kills made by much larger animals.

pets.name: Plains Monitor
pets.description: While stationary, the plains monitor will continuously flick its tail back and forth. From a distance this mimics the appearance of swaying tallgrass, camouflaging the lizard from aerial predators.

pets.name: Prairie Mouse
pets.description: On the prairie there are numerous rodents and other small creatures, but none more common than the mouse.

pets.name: Szechuan Chicken
pets.description: Will only lay eggs in bright light.

pets.name: Tolai Hare
pets.description: In the ancient fables, the first Tolai hare strode across the gulf between the stars before it upset them and they tumbled from the heavens to the world below.

pets.name: Tolai Hare Pup
pets.description: Tolai hare pups are sent from their dens at a young age to find their own way.

pets.name: Zooey Snake
pets.description: These reptiles possess hooked scales, allowing them to slither up Kun-Lai Summit's rocky slopes and steep cliffs.

pets.name: Amber Moth
pets.description: Known to flourish in the rainy season, this insect is drawn to lightning storms.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: Dread Wastes

Pet Battle: Townlong Steppes

pets.name: Grassland Hopper
pets.description: At night, the grassland hoppers fill the night with their maddening song. Those unaccustomed to it have spent many a sleepless night serenaded by their mating calls.

pets.name: Mongoose
pets.description: Contrary to its benign appearance, mongoose are dangerous carnivores, well known for their ability to hunt venomous snakes that could kill much larger creatures.

pets.name: Mongoose Pup
pets.description: Mongoose pups prefer long grass where only their mothers can find them.

pets.name: Yakrat
pets.description: The bond between yak and rat is a strange one, and what the rat gains out of the symbiotic relationship is a mystery.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Townlong Steppes, Dread Wastes

pets.name: Silent Hedgehog
pets.description: These hedgehogs may be silent, but often are heard the cries of those that foolishly step upon their quills.

pets.name: Clouded Hedgehog
pets.description: Hedgehogs are not at all fond of croquet nor flamingos.

pets.name: Rapana Whelk
pets.description: Has been spotted fighting other whelks for prime food sources.

pets.name: Resilient Roach
pets.description: The roaches of the Dread Wastes dwell in the shadows. Some people swear the shadows travel with them.

pets.name: Crunchy Scorpion
pets.description: Unique carapace is prized by trinket makers for its texture and strength.

pets.name: Emperor Crab
pets.description: The emperor crab was named for its regal appearance: the ridges of its shell and its raised claws eerily resembling a crown. One that would pinch your eyes out if you tried to wear it.

pets.name: Effervescent Glowfly
pets.description: Luminescent body used to attract mates.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Gilded Moth
pets.description: This delicate insect's wings are often sewn into clothing and armor.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Golden Civet
pets.description: Civets are landbound cousins of the otter and are prized for their heady musks.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Golden Civet Kitten
pets.description: The civets are known to guard their young ferociously.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Dancing Water Skimmer
pets.description: Named for their apparent dancelike behavior when skimming aquatic surfaces, the species uses erratic movements to avoid being devoured by fish and other underwater predators.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Yellow-Bellied Bullfrog
pets.description: Despite its menacing appearance, the yellow-bellied bullfrog was aptly named.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Garden Moth
pets.description: Known to flourish in the rainy season, this insect is drawn to lightning storms.

pets.name: Shrine Fly
pets.description: This species of insect is drawn to the latent energy in shrines, their luminescent appearance adding to the mystique of the places of power.

pets.name: Death's Head Cockroach
pets.description: The markings on the carapace of this cockroach closely resemble that of the Death's Head.

pets.name: Fungal Moth
pets.description: Prefers to dwell in dark caves and feed on Heartblossom nectar.

pets.name: Tiny Green Dragon
pets.description: Legends say that these vibrant emerald beings bring good fortune and safe travels to their owners.

pets.name: Tiny Red Dragon
pets.description: Said to bring good fortune when spotted in autumn.  Known to hide from unfamiliar creatures.

pets.name: Jade Crane Chick
pets.description: A graceful creature from the isle of Pandaria.
pets.source:
Vendor: Audrey Burnhep, Varzok

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 50TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Thundering Serpent Hatchling
pets.description: A baby version of the mighty Thundering Cloud Serpent that hails from the far lands of Pandaria.

pets.name: Wild Jade Hatchling
pets.description: So cute, yet so epic.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: The Jade Forest

Faction: Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)

pets.name: Wild Golden Hatchling
pets.description: The offspring of Tsulong, hidden away before the corruption of the Sha had fully taken hold of the Terrace of Endless Spring.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: The Jade Forest

Faction: Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)

pets.name: Wild Crimson Hatchling
pets.description: It's red, so it must fly faster.
pets.source:
Pet Battle: The Jade Forest

Faction: Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)

pets.name: Singing Cricket
pets.description: Known to feast on the tasty plants in Krasarang Wilds.
pets.source:
Achievement: Pro Pet Mob

Category: Pet Battle

pets.name: Feral Vermling
pets.description: It keeps looking at me. I think it wants to bite me.
pets.source:
Achievement: Going to Need More Leashes

Category: Collect

pets.name: Highlands Skunk
pets.description: This ferocious skunk can spray an attacker from thirty yards away, temporarily blinding them.  Handle with caution!

pets.name: Grinder
pets.description: Mogu sorcerers, keepers of the secret to bringing stone to life, prefer these stolid companions over more beastly familiars.
pets.source:
Drop: Karr the Darkener

Zone: Dread Wastes

pets.name: Hopling
pets.description: The great big world can be a dangerous place for such a tiny, adorable creature.
pets.source:
Achievement: Ling-Ting's Herbal Journey

Category: Dungeons and Raids

pets.name: Aqua Strider
pets.description: Water striders serve an important role in Jinyu culture, acting as a mount, means of sending communications, and even a family pet.
pets.source:
Drop: Nalash Verdantis

Zone: Dread Wastes

pets.name: Emerald Shale Hatchling
pets.description: Adventurers have reported rare sightings of a monstrous sized emerald shale spider, which the denizens of Deepholm have come to call the Jadefang.

pets.name: Amethyst Shale Hatchling
pets.description: Adult amethyst shale spiders prefer to create their nests against the outer walls of Deepholm.

pets.name: Mechanical Pandaren Dragonling
pets.description: Constructed from a seemingly impossible mass of gears, springs, wires, and a little something special, this dragonling embodies the spirit of Pandaria as seen through an engineer's goggles.

pets.name: Jade Owl
pets.description: Jade is naturally rich with life and color, making it the perfect raw material for this gentle companion.  It is said the wind created by their wings can soothe the troubled mind.

pets.name: Sapphire Cub
pets.description: While each cub is crafted in the same fashion, tiny imperfections in the gemstones create a unique personality when imbued with life.  They are, however, always playful and friendly.

pets.name: Fishy
pets.description: Many believe (incorrectly) that goldfish have no memories. Trainers who have worked with them know this is clearly not the case and have the bruises to prove it.
pets.source:
Quest: Let Them Burn

Zone: The Jade Forest

pets.name: Darkmoon Rabbit
pets.description: This rabbit is much stronger than it looks.
pets.source:
Drop: Darkmoon Rabbit

Zone: Darkmoon Island

pets.name: Chi-Ji Kite
pets.description: A beautiful kite brought to life by the scribes of Pandaria.

pets.name: Yu'lon Kite
pets.description: Who knew scribes could make kites?

pets.name: Horned Lizard
pets.description: Not only is it quick, it's loud too!

pets.name: Venus
pets.description: Seems odd that he doesn't like flies... right?
pets.source:
Achievement: That's a Lot of Pet Food

Category: Collect

pets.name: Jade Tentacle
pets.description: Careful now, she can get a bit frisky sometimes!
pets.source:
Achievement: Time To Open a Pet Store

Category: Pet Battles

pets.name: Pandaren Water Spirit
pets.description: Water spirits are especially mischievous, and are known to frequent the canals of the Stormstout Brewery.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Baneling
pets.description: A rolling, explosive member of the Zerg swarm, the baneling deals terrible, terrible damage. Very dangerous in close quarters.
pets.source: Promotion: StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm Collector's Edition

pets.name: Wanderer's Festival Hatchling
pets.description: Legend has it that a seadragon turtle just like this one grew up to become Shen-zin Su, the Wandering Isle. Perhaps your little turtle will grow into something amazing?
pets.source:
Pet Battle:  Krasarang Wilds

Event:  Wanderer's Festival

pets.name: Imperial Moth
pets.description: The larval form of this moth is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.

pets.name: Imperial Silkworm
pets.description: This plump red caterpillar is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.

pets.name: Red Cricket
pets.description: Be careful, he might eat all your crops!
pets.source:
Quest: Sho, Requires Exalted Friendship Faction

Zone: Valley of the Four Winds

pets.name: Darkmoon Hatchling
pets.description: Most of Violet's numerous forest strider hatchlings are turned into Faire fare by Stamp Thunderhorn, though a few are raised as mounts or purchased by adventurers looking for a petite purple pet.
pets.source:
Vendor: Lhara

Zone: Darkmoon Island

Cost: 90

pets.name: Darkmoon Glowfly
pets.description: Their eerie green light, reminiscent of fel flames, is occasionally seen flitting through the twisted trees of Darkmoon Island.

pets.name: Darkmoon Eye
pets.description: Don't even think about cheating now.

pets.name: Crow
pets.description: While smaller than the infamous ravens of Gilneas, crows are no less clever or cunning.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Occasionally appears alongside other creatures during battles on Darkmoon Island.

pets.name: Terky
pets.description: Terky is as shy as she is adorable, preferring the company of close friends over new ones.

pets.name: Cinder Kitten
pets.description: A playful, purring pyromaniac. Don't pet these kittens without fireproof mittens!

pets.name: Pandaren Fire Spirit
pets.description: Though it appears to be a vaguely-related cousin to the Cinder Kitten, the two creatures actually share no ancestry.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Pandaren Air Spirit
pets.description: These spirits represent the heart of Pandaria's elemental powers.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Pandaren Earth Spirit
pets.description: The elements of Pandaria can be cute and playful, until their homeland is threatened.
pets.source:
Quest: Pandaren Spirit Tamer

Zone: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

pets.name: Spectral Cub
pets.description: Capable of sitting in even the smallest of boxes, thanks to its ghostly nature.

pets.name: Sumprush Rodent
pets.description: A rodent of usual size.

pets.name: Clock'em
pets.description: Created for one purpose and one purpose alone: to punch little critters, as hard as it possibly can.
pets.source:
Vendor: Paul North

Zone: Brawl'gar Arena

Cost: 30TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Giant Bone Spider
pets.description: Found in a dusty egg clutch at the back of Maexxna's lair, these creatures are already undead when they hatch.

pets.name: Fungal Abomination
pets.description: Loatheb's body is covered in small pods capable of spreading blighted fungal spores up to 1000 yards given proper wind conditions.

pets.name: Mr. Bigglesworth
pets.description: Upon exiting the freezing necropolis of Naxxramas, Mr. Bigglesworth promptly found a warm spot in the sun to take a long nap in.
pets.source:
Achievement: Raiding with Leashes

Category: Collect

pets.name: Stitched Pup
pets.description: When Gluth died to a band of brave adventurers, these lil' guys were found in the corpse, gnawing on giant, undead bones.

pets.name: Harbinger of Flame
pets.description: Few of these fiery harbingers remain following Ragnaros' defeat in the Firelands.
pets.source:
Drop: Sulfuron Harbinger

Zone: Molten Core

pets.name: Corefire Imp
pets.description: These tiny flame imps roam the Molten Core in large swarms and can replenish their numbers rapidly.

pets.name: Ashstone Core
pets.description: The cooled core of Golemagg, it appears to retain some semi-sentient properties.
pets.source:
Drop: Golemagg the Incinerator

Zone: Molten Core

pets.name: Untamed Hatchling
pets.description: One of Razorgore's eggs that miraculously survived in Blackwing Lair.
pets.source:
Drop: Razorgore the Untamed

Zone: Blackwing Lair

pets.name: Chrominius
pets.description: Opponents that face this fierce chromatic monstrosity just hope it doesn't have Time Stop!

pets.name: Death Talon Whelpguard
pets.description: A runt of the Black Talon, left to guard the whelps.
pets.source:
Drop: Broodlord Lashlayer

Zone: Blackwing Lair

pets.name: Viscidus Globule
pets.description: This small globule didn't make it back to Viscidus in time to re-form.

pets.name: Anubisath Idol
pets.description: An anubisath idol from the Temple of Ahn'qiraj, infused with ancient qiraji magic.

pets.name: Mini Mindslayer
pets.description: The bane of many an adventurer, to look into its eyes is to truly know madness.
pets.source:
Drop: The Prophet Skeram

Zone: Ahn'Qiraj

pets.name: Harpy Youngling
pets.description: They only get more beautiful as they age.

pets.name: Stunted Yeti
pets.description: Hunted by locals for years, this is an extremely rare specimen.

pets.name: Lofty Libram
pets.description: Most people have never read this book.

pets.name: Arcane Eye
pets.description: Never take your eye off of it.

pets.name: Infinite Whelpling
pets.description: You better believe he knows what time it is.

pets.name: Fluxfire Feline
pets.description: Originally created by the engineers in the bowels of Gnomeregan, the Fluxfire Feline is a marvel of modern engineering.

pets.name: Anodized Robo Cub
pets.description: The engineering wizards in Everlook created this unique cub as a test model.  Unfortunately a few went rogue and were never recovered.

pets.name: Cogblade Raptor
pets.description: This model of raptors is produced in the Blade's Edge Mountains.  Their robotic roars are a common sound near Toshley Station.

pets.name: Nexus Whelpling
pets.description: The runts of Malygos brood, these whelplings are prized for their boundless arcane magics.

pets.name: Kun-Lai Runt
pets.description: Indigenous to the peaks of Kun-Lai Summit, this rare yeti is much more dangerous than it looks.

pets.name: Emerald Proto-Whelp
pets.description: These beautiful drakes can be found across the shores of Northrend.

pets.name: Murki
pets.description: Murki is one of the world's rarest species of murloc.

pets.name: Gusting Grimoire
pets.description: A fel-tainted tome whose secrets are so terrible and bizarre that its pages have taken on an eerie semblance of life. Found on many a warlock's nightstand.
pets.source: Trading Card Game: Betrayal of the Guardian

pets.name: Thundertail Flapper
pets.description: Touched by lightning, these dangerous rodents should be kept at a safe distance.

pets.name: Red Panda
pets.description: Can you believe how cute I am?  Me neither.

pets.name: Living Sandling
pets.description: Born of sand, these dangerous creatures can form and disperse in the blink of an eye.

pets.name: Sunreaver Micro-Sentry
pets.description: Loyal to the Sunreavers from creation, these pint-sized constructs can still pack a punch.
pets.source:
Drop: Haywire Sunreaver Construct

Zone: Isle of Thunder

pets.name: Electrified Razortooth
pets.description: Lightning can be seen flowing across its body, teeth to tail.

pets.name: Zandalari Kneebiter
pets.description: This unique raptor was born on the island of Zandalar and transported here along with the rest of the Zandalari army.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Elder Python
pets.description: These snakes have been known to swallow gnomes in one gulp.

pets.name: Swamp Croaker
pets.description: Probably best not to touch it.

pets.name: Son of Animus
pets.description: Forged in the Throne of Thunder, these tiny creations are servants of the great Dark Animus.
pets.source:
Drop: Animus

Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Stunted Direhorn
