pets.description: Even at this tiny size, Direhorns are known to wreak havoc on unsuspecting victims.
pets.source:
Achievement: Brutal Pet Brawler

Category: Battle

pets.name: Spectral Porcupette
pets.description: Something about this creature looks familiar...
pets.source:
Quest: A Large Pile of Giant Dinosaur Bones

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Sunfur Panda
pets.description: These cuddly rascals enjoy basking in the sun, sleeping in the sun, and napping in the sun.

pets.name: Snowy Panda
pets.description: The white fur of the Snowy Panda allows it to hide in the snowbanks of Kun-Lai Summit.

pets.name: Mountain Panda
pets.description: Cousin to the Snowy Panda, Mountain Pandas reside in the lower regions of Kun-Lai Summit.

pets.name: Pygmy Direhorn
pets.description: Don't pet the pointy end. Note: all of the ends are pointy.
pets.source:
Drop: Horridon

Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Spawn of G'nathus
pets.description: Some Pandaren believe G'nathus to be an ancient Zandalari Loa left behind to guard the waters south of Lei Shen's island citadel.

pets.name: Ji-Kun Hatchling
pets.description: Deadly offspring of the Ancient Mother, Ji-Kun Hatchlings are considered sacred treasures in many cultures.
pets.source:
Drop: Ji-Kun

Zone: Throne of Thunder

pets.name: Pierre
pets.description: Every cook's dream wrapped up in a perfect bundle of metal and bolts. Too bad what he cooks up isn't suitable for humanoid consumption. According to Jard's notes, he intends to make this little guy for his friend, Emily Cole.

pets.name: Direhorn Runt
pets.description: The Zandalari breed specific Direhorn species for their small size for use as mounts.
pets.source:
Drop: Direhorns

Zone: Isle of Giants

pets.name: Tiny Red Carp
pets.description: The red scales on these fish are believed to be a warning to predators of the Townlong Steppes and the Dread Wastes that their flesh is toxic. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

pets.name: Tiny Blue Carp
pets.description: These little guys can be found in the waters of the Timeless Isle, or swimming alongside Jewel Danio or Redbelly Mandarin. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

pets.name: Tiny Green Carp
pets.description: It is believed that the green coloration and stripes on the tiny green carp serve as camouflage in the waters of the Jade Forest, Valley of the Four Winds and the Krasarang Wilds. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

pets.name: Tiny White Carp
pets.description: These hardy fish can survive in a wide range of climates, from the snow capped mountains of Kun-Lai Summit to the temperate, salty waters of the oceans around Pandaria. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

pets.name: Zandalari Anklerender
pets.description: These tiny minions of Zandalar are adept at stowing away within the cargo holds of the enormous Zandalari warships.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Zandalari Footslasher
pets.description: Even at this size, these raptors can eviscerate an entire cow in less than 10 seconds.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Zandalari Toenibbler
pets.description: These adorable beasts are both cuddly and huggable, provided you do not enjoy having a face.
pets.source:
Drop: Zandalari Dinomancer

Zone: Isle Of Giants

pets.name: Lil' Bad Wolf
pets.description: The oft-forgotten offspring of the Big Bad Wolf, found gorged and asleep in a basket of sweets.
pets.source:
Drop: The Big Bad Wolf

Zone: Karazhan

pets.name: Menagerie Custodian
pets.description: Primary responsibilities include dusting Medivh's many magical artifacts, an activity which has claimed the life, sanity, or physical composition of the many caretakers preceding Moroes.

pets.name: Netherspace Abyssal
pets.description: Upon leaving Netherspace, Malchezaar's Abyssals become strangely distorted by Karazhan's magical protections, rendering them tiny, and much less likely to spontaneously erupt in flames.

pets.name: Fiendish Imp
pets.description: A minion of Terestian Illhoof, this tricky imp was left in Karazhan when the portal to the Twisting Nether closed behind it.

pets.name: Tideskipper
pets.description: An astounding find for the scientific community of Azeroth, who have long pondered, often in taverns, what a baby Sea Giant might look like.
pets.source:
Drop: Morogrim Tidewalker

Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Tainted Waveling
pets.description: The spawn of Hydross, considered by the elemental community to be the "Earl of Puddles."
pets.source:
Drop: Hydross the Unstable

Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Coilfang Stalker
pets.description: It is unknown how Lady Vashj empowers these Fen Striders with their mind-bending powers; even at an early age this creature shows significant psychic ability.
pets.source:
Drop: Lady Vashj

Zone: Serpentshrine Cavern

pets.name: Pocket Reaver
pets.description: Sent through the Twisting Nether by the great Archimonde the Defiler to terrorize tiny civilizations with their medium-sized stomping noises.
pets.source:
Drop: Void Reaver

Zone: Tempest Keep

pets.name: Lesser Voidcaller
pets.description: The lanterns carried by Voidcallers bridge the realms of the living and the dead, and often attract wayward ghosts and spirits.
pets.source:
Drop: High Astromancer Solarian

Zone: Tempest Keep

pets.name: Phoenix Hawk Hatchling
pets.description: These brightly-colored dragonhawks carry Kael'thas' forces swiftly and unerringly through the nether storm surrounding the Eye.

pets.name: Tito
pets.description: Though generally an expert at taking stage direction, the show had to be stopped on more than one occasion when Tito and Roar would lock eyes, resulting in an extended chase around the Karazhan Opera House.
pets.source:
Achievement: Raiding with Leashes II: Attunement Edition

Category: Collect

pets.name: Gahz'rooki
pets.description: The trolls have a long and storied history of summoning hydras. While he might not be the biggest or strongest hydra, Gahz'rooki will bite your fingers quite hard if you get too close.
pets.source:
Vendor: Ravika

Zone: Durotar

Cost: 1



Vendor: Tenuki

Zone: Durotar

Cost: 1

pets.name: Unborn Val'kyr
pets.description: Val'kyr are considered "unborn" until they vanquish a creature of high nobility.

pets.name: Living Fluid
pets.description: The dark pools in Primordius' chamber laid stagnant after the fall of the mogu, and murky thoughts began to coalesce.
pets.source:
Drop: Primordius

Zone: Throne of Thunder

Difficulty: Looking For Raid

pets.name: Viscous Horror
pets.description: These malicious oozes are highly sensitive to Primordius' pheromone signature.
pets.source:
Drop: Primordius

Zone: Throne of Thunder

Difficulty: Normal or Heroic

pets.name: Filthling
pets.description: Battle pet trainers are strongly encouraged to wash their hands for at least 30 minutes after playing with the filthling.

pets.name: Blossoming Ancient
pets.description: This budding ancient is a unique variety in Azeroth, created from the ever-living branches of the Great Tree, and can bloom in any season.

pets.name: Zeradar
pets.description: Infamous psionic battering ram of the Protoss, Zeradar is also the only archon that can utilize psionic storm. Power overwhelming!
pets.source: Promotion: StarCraft II: Legacy of the Void Collector's Edition

pets.name: Rascal-Bot
pets.description: This little guy seems to like to hang out at the fringes of cataclysmic events. There is no evidence to suggest he has anything to do with the cause of these events, though - he's probably just an observer. Or maybe he just gets lost on his trek to other places.

pets.name: Crafty
pets.description: Likely to flip out and kill someone.

pets.name: Xu-Fu, Cub of Xuen
pets.description: Fierce and loyal, Xu-Fu loves to hunt by moonlight.  Once during a full moon, he killed and ate an entire Ironfur Great Bull, prompting a two day nap.

pets.name: Moon Moon
pets.description: Moonfang's cubs grow into massive, slavering, black-furred killing machines...except for Moon Moon.

pets.name: Chi-Chi, Hatchling of Chi-Ji
pets.description: Chi-Chi tries to inspire hope with her loud squawk and by chasing, and eventually eating, butterflies.
pets.source:
Vendor: Master Li

Zone: Timeless Isle

Cost: 3

pets.name: Yu'la, Broodling of Yu'lon
pets.description: A master sculptor devoted her life to creating an incomparably beautiful statue, inspired by her love and reverence for Yu'lon.  When the sculptor passed away, Yu'lon breathed a fraction of her essence into the statue, bringing Yu'la into the world.
pets.source:
Vendor: Master Li

Zone: Timeless Isle

Cost: 3

pets.name: Zao, Calfling of Niuzao
pets.description: Always on the lookout for a fight or some tasty grass, Zao keeps his head down and eyes forward.

pets.name: Lil' Bling
pets.description: This handsome little robot is the spitting image of his "Dad", Blingtron 4000.  As a Blingtron's generosity circuits don't mature until they have been built to maximum specification, you shouldn't expect any free handouts from him.

pets.name: Azure Crane Chick
pets.description: Crane chicks of the Timeless Isle sometimes sing a curious song that calms the nerves and soothes the soul.
pets.source:
Drop: Crane Nest

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Blackfuse Bombling
pets.description: The first bombling created in the Underhold, Siegecrafter Blackfuse couldn't bear to see it destroyed, and kept it as a friendly, if explosive, pet.
pets.source:
Drop: Siegecrafter Blackfuse

Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

pets.name: Ashleaf Spriteling
pets.description: The Ashleaf Sprites of the Timeless Isle tirelessly protect the vegetation of the island from the burning fury of Ordos and his minions.

pets.name: Ashwing Moth
pets.description: Jinyu assassins employ this moth as both a portable decoy and a light source to reveal weak spots in their enemy's armor.

pets.name: Flamering Moth
pets.description: Cats and other curious critters often have short-lived play sessions with this moth that end with a face full of singed hair.

pets.name: Skywisp Moth
pets.description: This curious moth is sometimes found interrupting the spells of a wandering mage or warlock.

pets.name: Ruby Droplet
pets.description: The waters of Ruby Lake are colored a strange reddish hue, possibly due to the ruby crystals found deep within the mountains of the Timeless Isle.

pets.name: Dandelion Frolicker
pets.description: While fascinated by flowers, the frolicker has also been known to dance with blades of grass and the occasional weed.
pets.source:
Drop: Scary Sprite

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Death Adder Hatchling
pets.description: Late in life, if the environmental conditions are correct, a Death Adder may shed its skin and undergo a transformation into an Imperial Python.
pets.source:
Drop: Imperial Python

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Droplet of Y'Shaarj
pets.description: A small remnant of the power of Y'shaarj that spawned the Sha, a single Drop of Y'shaarj can magnify emotional states for thousands of yards, causing entire towns to shut down in fear or doubt.
pets.source:
Drop: Sha of Pride

Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

Difficulty: Flexible, Normal or Heroic

pets.name: Gooey Sha-ling
pets.description: Sha-lings reflect the emotional state of their handler, becoming agitated, depressed, fearful, or doubtful depending on the magnitude of negative thoughts around them.
pets.source:
Drop: Sha of Pride

Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

Difficulty: LFR and Flexible

pets.name: Jademist Dancer
pets.description: The Jademist Dancers of the Timeless Isle have a curious attraction to the steam vents of the northwestern shore.
pets.source:
Drop: Jademist Dancer

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Kovok
pets.description: The tiny terror of the Dread Wastes, Kovok prefers a steady diet of "brain food:" mushan brains, human brains, any brains really. This strange nutritional requirement may be tangentally related to his enormous head.
pets.source:
Drop: Paragons of the Klaxxi

Raid: Siege of Orgrimmar

pets.name: Ominous Flame
pets.description: The odd blue flames found within the Cavern of Lost Spirits have led many unwary adventurers to their doom.
pets.source:
Drop: Foreboding Flame

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Skunky Alemental
pets.description: When the village of Pi'jiu was attacked by the Ordon Yaungol generations ago, the villagers bravely erected a keg in the center of the village. The following morning, after the celebration had died down, the still-drunken Yaungol blearily agreed to a peace treaty.
pets.source:
Drop: Zhu-Gon the Sour

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Spineclaw Crab
pets.description: Spineclaw crabs of Pandaria have existed for thousands of years and remain one of the continent's oldest creatures.
pets.source:
Drop: Monstrous Spineclaw

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Gulp Froglet
pets.description: Gulp frogs of the Timeless Isle can feast upon prey several times larger than themselves by slowly digesting the victim externally with a toxic slime.

pets.name: Bonkers
pets.description: Some young and rambunctious hozen are trained from an early age to use boxing gloves so they don't accidentally kill their tribe members, and more importantly, to keep them from picking their noses.
pets.source:
Drop: Kukuru Chest

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Vengeful Porcupette
pets.description: One of the beasts left on the Timeless Isle when it shifted through time, most likely sacrificed by the Ordon to their demigod, Ordos.
pets.source:
Vendor: Speaker Gulan

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Gu'chi Swarmling
pets.description: Swarmlings of Gu'chi spin an ancient, and very powerful, form of silk that has not been seen in Pandaria in ages.
pets.source:
Drop: Gu'chi the Swarmbringer

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Harmonious Porcupette
pets.description: Prolonged exposure to Shaohao's tranquil mists has calmed these spirits, which act as peaceful companions to the Mistweavers.
pets.source:
Vendor: Mistweaver Ku

Zone: Timeless Isle

Faction: Shaohao - Pathwalker

pets.name: Jadefire Spirit
pets.description: The Jadefire Spirit is thought to be a living embodiment of Yu'lon's own jade breath.
pets.source:
Drop: Spirit of Jadefire

Zone: Timeless Isle

pets.name: Rotten Little Helper
pets.description: Fed up with long hours, low pay, and entitled adventurers whining about sub-standard Winter Veil gifts, these nasty little creatures fled their magical workshops to join up with the Abominable Greench.
pets.source: World Event: Feast of Winter Veil

pets.name: Sky Lantern
pets.description: A candle inside of the kite heats the air, causing it to rise into the air without the need for wind.

pets.name: Macabre Marionette
pets.description: These possessed puppets are given a semblance of life by whimsical spirits of the departed.
pets.source: World Event: Day of the Dead

pets.name: Alterac Brew-Pup
pets.description: A mastiff bred for rescue, the Alterac brewhound's bloodline is famous for having found and resuscitated many mountain travelers trapped beneath the snow... and then slobbering all over them.

pets.name: Murkalot
pets.description: We're Crusaders from a fable. We dance whene'er we're able. We do routines and chorus scenes, with footwork impeccable!

pets.name: Treasure Goblin
pets.description: Watch your coin purse.
pets.source: Promotion: Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls Collector's Edition

pets.name: Hogs
pets.description: Tenacious and terrible, the mighty Hogs slaughters weaker enemies without hesitation.
pets.source:
Achievement: That's Whack!

Category: Darkmoon Faire

pets.name: Albino Chimaeraling
pets.description: Both heads are equally fearsome on the terrifying chimaera, each capable of its own unique breath attack.

pets.name: Dread Hatchling
pets.description: The dark wings will cloud and consume the minds of the weak, because they are just so adorable!
pets.source: Promotion: Warlords of Draenor Collector's Edition

pets.name: Iron Starlette
pets.description: This massive weapon of destruction has been miniaturized for use in the garden.  Moles beware!
pets.source:
Quest: Report to the King (Alliance), Warning the Warchief (Horde)

Zone: Blasted Lands (90+)

pets.name: Weebomination
pets.description: Made from bits and pieces of vanquished battle pets, dark magic, and just a pinch of love.

pets.name: Lil' Leftovers
pets.description: Cute enough to eat, but not recommended.

pets.name: Crazy Carrot
pets.description: Left to their own devices, carrots will simply lose their minds.
pets.source:
Vendor: Naron Bloomthistle

Zone: Lunarfall

Cost: 1000



Vendor: Tarnon

Zone: Frostwall

Cost: 1000

pets.name: Mechanical Axebeak
pets.description: Squeeeeeeeawk!

pets.name: Royal Peachick
pets.description: A single peacock feather is often laid upon a grave to ward off evil spirits.

pets.name: Lifelike Mechanical Frostboar
pets.description: After many complaints that taming young boars was a painful experience, engineers came to the rescue with this creepily lifelike model.

pets.name: Teroclaw Hatchling
pets.description: The teroclaw is a potent hunter of the small and furry.

pets.name: Elekk Plushie
pets.description: This adorable little elephant is always there for you.

pets.name: Frostfur Rat
pets.description: Annoying and destructive, they can be coaxed with enough cheese to become a tolerable companion.

pets.name: Zomstrok
pets.description: Zomstrok is evil incarnate, the unholy mistake of someone maddened by isolation, a creation that could not be undone.
pets.source:
Drop: Reanimated Darktide Boneshell, Darktide Husk

Zone: Shadowmoon Valley

pets.name: Autumnal Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.

pets.name: Forest Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
pets.source:
Vendor:  Kwilax Fuseshiv

Faction: Steamwheedle Preservation Society - Revered

Cost: 1000TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Kelp Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.

pets.name: Nightshade Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.

pets.name: Sassy Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.

pets.name: Sun Sproutling
pets.description: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.

pets.name: Leatherhide Runt
pets.description: Many years ago, an ogre tried to use a leatherhide runt as kickball.  He was forever known as Onefoot afterwards.

pets.name: Mud Jumper
pets.description: Orcish children have a tradition where they sneak up on a mud jumper and whisper a secret they wish to come true.  If the mud jumper doesn't jump, the wish will come true.
pets.source: Pet Battle: Highmountain, Nagrand, Spires of Arak, Talador

pets.name: Ghastly Kid
pets.description: In the ultimate demonstration of stubborness, this once-living nannie simply refused to die.

pets.name: Meadowstomper Calf
pets.description: The intelligence and caring nature of elekk calves make them a stalwart lifelong companion.

pets.name: Moonshell Crab
pets.description: The moonshell crab reflects light so well that they can be picked up and used as a mirror.  Just keep your face away from the claws!

pets.name: Sea Calf
pets.description: The sea calf has a natural affinity for balancing things.
pets.source:
Profession: Fishing

Vendor: Nat Pagle

Zone: Garrison, Fishing Shack

Cost: 50

pets.name: Deathwatch Hatchling
pets.description: This hatchling has an unusual sense that allows it to detect and follow along with alpha predators.
pets.source:
Vendor: Guild Vendor

Zone: Stormwind, Orgrimmar

Cost: 300TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0

pets.name: Draenei Micro Defender
pets.description: While these tiny mechanical guardians were created to protect domesticated elekks from pests, they also turned out to be really good at giving back massages.
pets.source:
Vendor: Vinidcator Nuurem

Reputation: Council of Exarchs

pets.name: Molten Corgi
pets.description: Loves to herd imps, roll around in lava, and snuggle with elemental lords.
pets.source:
Achievement: WoW's 10th Anniversary

Category: Feats of Strength

pets.name: River Calf
pets.description: Surprisingly quick when provoked, but easily calmed with a meal of Nagrand arrowbloom.

pets.name: Murkidan
pets.description: After consuming the shin bone of Gul'dan, this fiesty demon hunter was caged for 10000 years by his brother Murkfurion.

pets.name: Mossbite Skitterer
pets.description: Camoflauged like moss, the skitterer will hide in trees and leap on their victims from above.

pets.name: Thicket Skitterer
pets.description: Their deceptively cute looks will lure in their prey, and then greet them with a flurry of devastating swipes. Hug with caution.

pets.name: Icespine Hatchling
pets.description: Equipped with extremely sharp claws, these frigid hatchlings dig through thick layers of ice and rock for shelter.

pets.name: Bone Wasp
pets.description: One ogre ritual involves cupping a bone wasp in their hands and shaking vigorously.  The venom increases strength and invokes vivid imagery.
pets.source:
Vendor: Faction Vendor

Reputation: Laughing Skull

pets.name: Bloodsting Wasp
pets.description: Contrary to popular belief, bloodsting wasps do not feed on blood, but love.

pets.name: Wood Wasp
pets.description: Wood wasps make nests in dead or hollowed out trees, and are quick to attack anything that threatens their home.

pets.name: Twilight Wasp
pets.description: In the moonlight their wings create a glittering aura, giving the illusion of twinkling starlight.

pets.name: Amberbarb Wasp
pets.description: Amberbarbs often try to provoke larger creatures to attack it. Once their victim strikes them, they will retaliate with the entire hive.

pets.name: Brightpaw
pets.description: This magical kitty has so much energy that she will sometimes zip around for no reason whatsoever.

pets.name: Sky-Bo
pets.description: The Sky-Bo was originally designed by the infamous Millie Watt as a toy for her cat.  The cat just slept in the box next to it.

pets.name: Bloodbeak
pets.description: The ancient tribes of Draenor were known to harvest their sharp beaks for crude tools and weapons.

pets.name: Junglebeak
pets.description: The colorful plumage from these birds are highly sought after by collectors. It is rumored that wearing these feathers will bring you good luck.

pets.name: Axebeak Hatchling
pets.description: The edges of its beak are particularly sharp. Watch your fingers during feeding time!

pets.name: Fruit Hunter
pets.description: This anxious avian has a voracious appetite for fruit.
pets.source:
Drop: Wiggling Egg

Zone: Frostfire Ridge

pets.name: Syd the Squid
pets.description: This tiny squid seems to enjoy wearing pants, but where in the world would you find some that fit?

pets.name: Ore Eater
pets.description: They eat and eat and eat, until they grow large.  Then they eat some more.

pets.name: Lovebird Hatchling
pets.description: Of course there are hatchlings, they're called Lovebirds aren't they?
pets.source:
World Event: Love is in the Air

Vendor: Lovely Merchant

Cost: 40

pets.name: Mystical Spring Bouquet
pets.description: Animated by magical means, and chlorophyll.
pets.source:
World Event: Noblegarden

Vendor: Noblegarden Merchant

Cost: 100

pets.name: Stonegrinder
pets.description: The master-crafted gear assembly and precision joints in this robot are clearly made with love.

pets.name: Bush Chicken
pets.description: Following their introduction to the mainland by the goblins, Bush Chickens have become the entre du jour for Pilgrim's Bounty due to their high deliciousness and low intelligence.

pets.name: Blazing Cindercrawler
pets.description: Tiny, incinerated corpses of various insects line its cage.
pets.source:
World Event: Midsummer Fire Festival

Vendor: Midsummer Merchant, Midsummer Supplier

Cost: 350

pets.name: Stout Alemental
pets.description: The Pandaren Brewmasters accidentally brought a barrel of Uncle Gao's last sentient batch of brew with them to Brewfest.
pets.source:
World Event: Brewfest

Vendor: Belbi Quikswitch

Zone: Dun Morogh

Cost: 200



Vendor: Bliz Fixwidget

Zone: Durotar

Cost: 200

pets.name: Cursed Birman
pets.description: One of this cat's nine lives has returned to haunt the living by yowling loudly when you're trying to sleep.
pets.source:
World Event: Hallow's End

Vendor: Chub

Zone: Tirisfal Glades

Cost: 150



Vendor: Dorothy

Zone: Stormwind City

Cost: 150

pets.name: Widget the Departed
pets.description: Not even death would stop this kitten's insatiable curiosity.
pets.source:
World Event: Hallow's End

Vendor: Chub

Zone: Tirisfal Glades

Cost: 150



Vendor: Dorothy

Zone: Stormwind City

Cost: 150

pets.name: Netherspawn, Spawn of Netherspawn
pets.description: This slime has a long and confusing lineage.

pets.name: Frostwolf Ghostpup
pets.description:
The little wolf told to stay.
Watching, waiting, for vacant prey.
Too proud to leave, she slipped away.
Unburdened now, forever free to play.

pets.name: Ancient Nest Guardian
pets.description: The ancient nest guardian was designed with the unthinkable in mind: to hate cats.

pets.name: Ikky
pets.description: Kaliri hatchlings feast on grubs when they're young, and eventually graduate to anything smaller than themselves.
pets.source:
Quest: Ikky's Egg

Zone: Spires of Arak

pets.name: Lanticore Spawnling
pets.description: No one knows what deep part of Blackwing Descent the Lanticore was kept in, but it probably smelled pretty awful.
pets.source:
Drop: The Lanticore

Zone: Upper Black Rock Spire

pets.name: Zangar Spore
pets.description: In Draenor, the Zangar Sea seeks to overtake the land by releasing thousands of these spores and slowly growing inland over time.
pets.source:
Drop: Fel-Touched Pet Supplies

Zone: Tanaan Jungle

pets.name: Crimson Spore
pets.description: A spore plucked from the Crimson Fen, an area of Gorgrond that was swallowed when Draenor was torn apart by nether magics.

pets.name: Umbrafen Spore
pets.description: The deep blue Umbrafen would later become home to a tribe of Broken.
pets.source:
Drop: Strange Spore

Zone: Shadowmoon Valley

pets.name: Seaborne Spore
pets.description: A spore from Zangarra, a central area of the Zangar encroachment that would later bloom into the Zangarmarsh.
pets.source:
Drop: Fel-Touched Pet Supplies

Zone: Tanaan Jungle

pets.name: Brilliant Spore
pets.description: Brilliant spores are very rarely seen, found deep under the waves of Draenor within the darkest corners of the Zangar fungal encroachment.
pets.source:
Drop: Rotcap

Zone: Spires of Arak

pets.name: Hydraling
pets.description: The hydraling can be an expensive pet, as it is capable of eating from three food bowls at the same time.
pets.source:
Drop: Vasha's Egg

Zone: Spires of Arak

pets.name: Frostwolf Pup
pets.description: These pups are bundles of fur and teeth until they grow up, at which point they are really just teeth.

pets.name: Pygmy Cow
pets.description: Originally bred to make milk more palatable for gnomes.

pets.name: Hatespark the Tiny
pets.description: His hate is not diminished by size.
pets.source:
Drop: Ragnaros the Firelord

Zone: Molten Core (Anniversary Edition)

pets.name: Firewing
pets.description: Don't line her cage with paper unless you want a fire.

pets.name: Stormwing
pets.description: Half bird, half elemental, the beautiful Stormwing is truly capable of shock and awe.

pets.name: Bronze Whelpling
pets.description: The Bronze Whelpling was lost in time until an unusual event allowed her to escape.
pets.source:
Drop: Iron Horde

Zone: Blasted Lands

pets.name: Doom Bloom
pets.description: A clear indication why goblin fertilizers should be used sparingly.

pets.name: Mechanical Scorpid
pets.description: Iron, iron, steel and fire.  Bellows, gears, plates, and wire.

pets.name: Everbloom Peachick
pets.description: These tiny creatures seem to favor big, fluffy nests, preferably atop an animal-loving dryad.

pets.name: Sentinel's Companion
pets.description: The companion of a night elf sentinel, rarely given out as a gift.

pets.name: Puddle Terror
pets.description: Living so closely to the water's surface, the puddle terror is not only friend to all aquatic creatures, it is one.

pets.name: Soul of the Forge
pets.description: When forging enchanted steel, bits of magic seep into the coals.  Over a period of years, decades even, the unbound energy slowly takes form, creating a tiny elemental being of immense fortitude.

pets.name: Sunfire Kaliri
